org.jtrim.image.transform

Class ImageTransformerData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerData
  • Deprecated. 
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines the input of an image transformer.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    @Deprecated
public final class ImageTransformerData
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageTransformerData

        public ImageTransformerData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage sourceImage,
                    int destWidth,
                    int destHeight,
                    ImageMetaData metaData)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ImageTransformerData with the specified properties.

        Although both the source image and its meta-data is allowed to be null, it is recommended to provide at least one of them.

        Parameters:
        sourceImage - the image to be transformed. This argument can be null if the image is not available.
        destWidth - the required width for the result of the image transformation. That is, image transformers must create an image with destWidth width. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        destHeight - the required height for the result of the image transformation. That is, image transformers must create an image with destHeight height. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        metaData - the meta-data information of the original source image. This can be especially important to the image transformer when the source image is not available. This argument can be null if the meta-data of the image is not available. Note that the width and height specified in the meta-data might be different than the source image because the meta-data refers to the original source image.

    • Method Detail

      • getImageWidth

        public int getImageWidth()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the width of the source image or -1 if it is not known.

        If the source image is not null, this method simply returns getSourceImage().getWidth(). If the source image is null but the meta-data is not, then this method returns getMetaData().getWidth(). If none of them is available -1 is returned.

        Returns:
        the width of the source image or -1 if it is not known

      • getImageHeight

        public int getImageHeight()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the height of the source image or -1 if it is not known.

        If the source image is not null, this method simply returns getSourceImage().getHeight(). If the source image is null but the meta-data is not, then this method returns getMetaData().getHeight(). If none of them is available -1 is returned.

        Returns:
        the height of the source image or -1 if it is not known

      • getSrcWidth

        public int getSrcWidth()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the width of the source image ignoring the meta-data, or 0 if the source image is not available.
        Returns:
        the width of the source image ignoring the meta-data, or 0 if the source image is not available

      • getSrcHeight

        public int getSrcHeight()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the height of the source image ignoring the meta-data, or 0 if the source image is not available.
        Returns:
        the height of the source image ignoring the meta-data, or 0 if the source image is not available

      • getDestHeight

        public int getDestHeight()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the height of the required result of the image transformation. This method returns the same value as specified at construction time.
        Returns:
        the height of the required result of the image transformation

      • getDestWidth

        public int getDestWidth()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the width of the required result of the image transformation. This method returns the same value as specified at construction time.
        Returns:
        the width of the required result of the image transformation

      • getMetaData

        public ImageMetaData getMetaData()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the meta-data information of the source image or null if it is not available. This method returns the same object as specified at construction time.

        Note: The width and height of the meta-data might not be the same as the image to be transformed because, the meta-data stores the width and height of the original source image (and the current source image might already be a transformed image).

        Returns:
        the meta-data information of the source image or null if it is not available

      • getSourceImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSourceImage()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the source image to be transformed or null if it is not available. This method returns the same object as specified at construction time.

        Note: If the source image is not available, the image transformer might be able to render something relying on the meta-data (if it is available).

        Returns:
        the source image to be transformed or null if it is not available
